The Coding Life

Learning to Code: Week 4 Update

Another “good news, bad news” week Learning to Code.

Good news: I finished Codecademy’s Ruby track. It is the first tutorial I have completed. Granted, it was very basic, and did lots of prompting, but almost without exception, I understood the concepts. It felt great to finish something and feel like I hit all the major components of this language I’m trying to learn. I followed that up with Ruby in 100 Minutes, following the prework track from MakerSquare. It took a little over a day and was a cursory review of what I had just learned. Next up was Ruby Monk.

Bad news: Ruby Monk kicked my butt. Not right out of the gate, but kick it did. About halfway through (why is it always halfway through?) I got to a point where I couldn’t complete the problems I was given. I had covered the appropriate sections, but I just couldn’t get through them. I do believe they are great problems, so I didn’t want to look at the answers. I’m going to go ahead and push through the rest of the tutorial and save these problems for when my skill level is higher.

Now I have to decide what to do for my next step. What tutorial will be the best thing for me to use given that I’ve now seen most of these concepts several times. The road ends with understanding, so that’s what I’m after.

Jun 13, 2014

M
